sections.title: Prescription anti-wrinkle treatments
sections.body:
Anti-wrinkle treatments are used to soften the appearance of certain facial lines by temporarily relaxing specific muscles that contribute to them over time.

These treatments are medical procedures and should be approached carefully. A thorough consultation is essential to assess suitability, discuss expectations, and explain how treatment works.

Our focus is on subtle, natural-looking outcomes that respect facial balance rather than dramatic change.
bullets: Assessment of facial movement and medical history before prescribing
Conservative dosing tailored to your goals and muscle activity
Review appointments to monitor comfort and refine only when safe

sections.title: Prescriber-led treatment with transparent risks
items: Prescription issued only after a face-to-face assessment and consent discussion
Doses recorded and mapped to your facial anatomy to avoid a frozen look
Sterile technique with single-use needles and antisepsis at each site
Safety guidance on expected effects, rare adverse events, and how to contact us quickly

sections.title: We prescribe only when treatment is appropriate
sections.body:
Anti-wrinkle treatments do not treat all types of facial lines and will not replace skin care, volume treatments, or surgical options where these are more appropriate.

As with any medical procedure, there are risks and possible side effects. These are discussed in full during consultation.

Treatment is only provided following appropriate assessment, discussion, and informed consent.
bullets: Full medical history, medicines, and contraindication checks
Facial mapping to balance doses and avoid brow or lid heaviness
Explanation of onset (usually several days) and duration (often up to 3–4 months)
Written aftercare and review scheduling before you leave

sections.title: For suitable patients seeking gentle softening
items: Suitability depends on individual facial anatomy, medical history, and personal goals.
Anti-wrinkle treatments may not be appropriate for everyone. Certain medical conditions, medications, or life stages can affect whether treatment is advised.
We carry out a full medical consultation before recommending any treatment and will advise honestly if it is not suitable — including when doing nothing is the better option.

sections.title: Consult, prescribe, treat, and review
items: Anti-wrinkle treatments work by reducing muscle activity in targeted areas of the face. This can soften lines that form through repeated facial movement.
The effect is temporary and develops gradually over several days. Treatment does not stop the ageing process, but it can soften the appearance of certain lines for a limited period.
Your practitioner will explain which areas may benefit and what level of change is realistic.
sections.strapline: Results are temporary and depend on your response. We avoid high doses or rushed top-ups to protect facial function.

sections.title: Mapped injection points for balanced results
sections.body: We plan doses per muscle group, favouring multiple micro-injections to distribute medicine evenly. Needle gauge and depth are chosen to respect underlying vessels and avoid diffusion into unintended areas.
sections.mediaHint: Prescription anti-wrinkle vials prepared with micro-needles

sections.title: Clear guidance and prompt escalation routes
items: Treatment appointments are typically brief and involve carefully placed injections in specific facial muscles.
Results are not immediate and usually develop over several days. Effects are temporary and gradually wear off, meaning repeat treatment may be required to maintain the result.
We explain the process, aftercare, and potential risks before treatment begins so you can make an informed decision.

faqs.question: How long do results last?
faqs.answer: Results develop gradually and wear off over time. The duration varies between individuals, and we discuss realistic expectations during consultation.

faqs.question: Will I look frozen?
faqs.answer: Our approach focuses on careful assessment and conservative dosing. The aim is a softer appearance while maintaining natural facial movement.

faqs.question: Does it hurt?
faqs.answer: Most patients report brief pinpricks. Topical anaesthetic can be provided if needed, and we use fine needles to reduce discomfort.

faqs.question: Can I combine this with other treatments?
faqs.answer: We often stage anti-wrinkle care with fillers, skin boosters, or polynucleotides when suitable. Sequencing is planned in consultation to keep safety first.

faqs.question: What if I decide not to continue?
faqs.answer: Results wear off over time. We document doses so future care can be paused or adjusted without pressure.

sections.title: When this fits and what else to consider
sections.body: In our clinic we usually stage this after facial aesthetics consultation (/treatments/facial-aesthetics) so the plan stays safe and measured.
bullets: Appropriate when you want to find out how anti-wrinkle injections are used and whether they match your goals.
Often follows Facial aesthetics consultation (/treatments/facial-aesthetics); Routine skin health checks (/treatments/preventative-and-general-dentistry).
Alternatives we balance: Anti-wrinkle pathways (/treatments/anti-wrinkle-treatments); Dermal fillers (/treatments/dermal-fillers).
Next steps we plan for: Skin boosters (/treatments/skin-boosters); Polynucleotides (/treatments/polynucleotides); Therapeutic injectables (/treatments/therapeutic-facial-injectables).

sections.title: Book a facial therapeutics consultation
sections.strapline: Explore whether prescription anti-wrinkle treatment is right for you with a prescriber who favours careful dosing and clear follow-up.
